item.title: By: rogerglewis
item.dc:creator: rogerglewis
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/12/23/over-population-paper-how-big-a-waste-paper-basket-ayers-quite-so-twofingers2brino-4pamphleteers-grubstreetjorno-wiki_ballot-financialeyes-iabato-sam-ge2019-roger-lewis-porthos-joebl/comment-page-1/#comment-11648">Clive Lord</a>.
Hello Clive, It is always very nice to hear from you, thank you for your comment. Needless to say we both know that we have quite opposite views regarding "Climate Crisis", Population Crisis etc. Even the Tragedy of the Commons. Our Positions are as Polarised as Those of Simon and Ehrlich I dare say, But I do Listen Too and respect your arguments even though I disagree and do not believe your arguments are supported by evidence. Where we do agree is on UBI , Universal Basic Income and the Circular Economy our positions are clearly delineated in our discussion on Money Creation and Policy 661 in the 2015 GP manifesto.
/2016/08/31/the-magic-money-tree-and-private-banks-misunderstood-and-kind-to-small-children-and-animalsor-just-another-fix-of-crony-capitalists/
You may find my debate with Steven Kurz of some interest
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=giGK27ZuR3k
he is a dyed in the wool Club of ROmer and I have little time for His arguments, your own I have time for as your authenticity recommends you and as I say I respect your Opinions. Best Wishes, Roger
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Clive Lord.

Hello Clive,
It is always very nice to hear from you, thank you for your comment.
Needless to say we both know that we have quite opposite views regarding “Climate Crisis”, Population Crisis etc. Even the Tragedy of the Commons.
Our Positions are as Polarised as Those of Simon and Ehrlich I dare say,
But I do Listen Too and respect your arguments even though I disagree and do not believe your arguments are supported by evidence.
Where we do agree is on UBI , Universal Basic Income and the Circular Economy our positions are clearly delineated in our discussion on Money Creation and Policy 661 in the 2015 GP manifesto.

/2016/08/31/the-magic-money-tree-and-private-banks-misunderstood-and-kind-to-small-children-and-animalsor-just-another-fix-of-crony-capitalists/

You may find my debate with Steven Kurz of some interest

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=giGK27ZuR3k

he is a dyed in the wool Club of ROmer and I have little time for His arguments, your own I have time for as your authenticity recommends you and as I say I respect your Opinions.
Best Wishes,
Roger

item.title: By: Clive Lord
item.dc:creator: Clive Lord
item.description: I have just received this as a referral on my weblog. All very plausible, but there are clues that the world IS already seriously overpopulated. Jared Diamond cites 17 genocides between the discovery of America (1492) and 1990, when 'The rise and Fall of the third Chimpanzee' was written. There have been three since. Migration, much of it due to over-use of renewable resources, in turn due to climate breakdown . . . We are the only species who have not yet limited our numbers SOON ENOUGH. Previous expanding species (the first amphibians, and birds) could only exterminate themselves. Humans have the power to wreck the entire ecosphere.
item.content:encoded:
I have just received this as a referral on my weblog. All very plausible, but there are clues that the world IS already seriously overpopulated. Jared Diamond cites 17 genocides between the discovery of America (1492) and 1990, when ‘The rise and Fall of the third Chimpanzee’ was written. There have been three since.
Migration, much of it due to over-use of renewable resources, in turn due to climate breakdown . . .
We are the only species who have not yet limited our numbers SOON ENOUGH.
Previous expanding species (the first amphibians, and birds) could only exterminate themselves. Humans have the power to wreck the entire ecosphere.

item.description: […] 1 THOUGHT ON “#165. TO CATCH A FALLING KNIFE” Simon Hodges on February 29, 2020 at 7:30 pm said: This is all about nCov and supply chains. Nothing to do with energy. The effects will be 10X worse than the GFC. Reply ↓ rogerglewis on February 29, 2020 at 7:45 pm said: Your comment is awaiting moderation. Agreed. There is something of the Problem of the Tool here.
